Description: LIST - Fetches list of readable Policy objects
summary: Returns a list of readable Policy objects
responseOK: A list of Policy objects readable for the current session's credentials.

Description: CREATE - Creates a new Policy object and returns the new object and a PolicyRevision
responseOK: A set consisting of the new Policy object created, together with the initial Revision object.

Description: READ - get a Policy object + PolicyRevision
UPDATE - Updates an existing Policy object, returning the updated version and a new revision
READ - fetches the latest version of an Agreement
CREATE - A new Agreement object is created and returned together with AgreementRevision
UPDATE - An existing Agreement object is created and returned together with AgreementRevision
READ - fetches a ConsentRecord
UPDATE - invalidates withdraws a ConsentRecord
CREATE - Creates an Individual in the Consent system
READ - Fetch an Individual in the Consent system
UPDATE - Updates an Individual in the Consent system
DELETE - entirely removes an individual from the system and cascades necessary actions to related ConsentRecord objects
LIST - Fetch agreements
LIST - Fetch consent records. For a given Agreement and Individual, query if consent exists
READ - Fetch a specific agreement
READ - Fetch an AgreementChoice
CREATE - For a particular Individual and a particular Agreement, create a new Consent Record pointing to the current Revision of a given Agreement
DELETE - Cascading delete operation for Right To Be Forgotten, deletes all Consent Records that shall not be retained and have a "forgettable" Agreement.
For asynchronous flows, the Consenent Management BB will require a callback from the Registry BB when saving and updating records on an Individual.

Endpoint slug: PII - Make Individual ID stored as some kind of anonymous token in HTTP headers, session state or like-wise. We should avoid spilling over individually identifiable data in HTTP server logs etc.
Is there a "Registry BB" (used in UC sequence diagrams) -- or just a Registration BB?
